title: Garamond Premier Pro bug?
content:
Hi there, I was testing some display faces, and set a word in Garamond Premier Pro Display Light at 150 pts. I wonder what happened to the left stem of the capital h!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [h.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017185008/http:/typophile.com/files/h_1.jpg) | 18.52 KB |
author: ncaleffi

comments.content: It looks normal [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017185008/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/garamond-premier/lt-disp/glyphs.html#glyphs/505858/41). It might be a rendering problem in your software. Did the glyph look equally strange at other sizes and in other applications?

The capital H looks strange only in the Light Display weight, set at any size, and in different applications (Indesign, Photoshop, Text Edit). I wonder if anybody else who owns the font could test it.

The capital H of GaramondPremrPro-LtDisp.otf,  
release 2.000;ADBE;GaramondPremrPro-LtDisp  
with internal date 21.07.2007 is definitely defective:

[http://www.sanskritweb.net/temporary/GaramondPremrPro-LtDisp-H.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017185008/http:/www.sanskritweb.net/temporary/GaramondPremrPro-LtDisp-H.jpg "http://www.sanskritweb.net/temporary/GaramondPremrPro-LtDisp-H.jpg")

It is strange, but the older release  
1.014;ADBE;GaramondPremrPro-LtDisp  
with the internal date 28.04.2005 did not  
have this defect.

Who knows other releases?

Confirm 2.000;ADBE;GaramondPremrPro-LtDisp (character H) IS DEFECTIVE...  
But newest release 2.061 is fine...
